cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 575 mi SE of Cape Fear, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: tracking west-northwest, then northwest, expected to slow and make landfall along the southern North Carolina coast before drifting inland across the Carolinas

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch north of NC/VA border to Cape Charles Light VA (does not include NJ)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane and Storm-Surge Warnings from South Santee River SC to Duck NC, including Pamlico/Albemarle Sounds
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Primary impact expected along the North and South Carolina coasts with secondary effects up the Mid-Atlantic seaboard
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤4%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts below 39 mph possible late weekend
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant surge expected in New Jersey, but elevated surf and minor tidal flooding possible
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential 3–6 inches with locally higher totals, producing brief flash-flooding and drainage issues
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and rough surf; possible river flooding from upstream rainfall could disrupt ground transport to the port
